author: Elaine Glusac
title: Friday’s Travel News: Live Art at the Evelyn; Celebrating the Revolution; Elvis Week in Memphis - The New York Times
text:

LIVE ART AT THE EVELYN
This weekend in New York, the artist Kelsey Montague will begin a four-day residency at the Evelyn hotel in the NoMad neighborhood while creating one of her signature murals of wings. The new work will cover an 11-by-19-foot movable wall done in pen and ink in the lobby from Aug. 2 to 5, when visitors can drop in to view her progress. In locations from Manhattan to Melbourne, Australia, Ms. Montague’s street murals have attracted passers-by to pose in front of them and the resulting images of winged fans, including Taylor Swift , have become popular on Instagram. The commission is part of a series of interactive experiences such as neighborhood walking tours that Triumph Hotels, which operates seven hotels in New York including the Evelyn, aim to offer guests.
